spec.name: Mohammed V
spec.bio: Mohammed V (born August 10, 1909, Fès, Morocco—died February 26, 1961, Rabat) was the Sultan of Morocco from 1927 to 1957 and subsequently King from 1957 to 1961. He became a central figure in Moroccan nationalist aspirations, successfully leading the country to independence from French colonial rule. His resistance to French demands and his exile further cemented his image as a national hero.

timeline.title: Became Sultan of Morocco
timeline.description: Ascended to the throne as Sultan of Morocco under the French Protectorate.

timeline.title: Exile by French Authorities
timeline.description: Exiled by French authorities, first to Corsica and then to Madagascar, due to his support for Moroccan independence.

timeline.title: Return from Exile
timeline.description: Returned to Morocco, signaling the imminent end of the Protectorate.

timeline.title: Moroccan Independence
timeline.description: Morocco gained independence from France with Mohammed V as Sultan.

timeline.title: Became King of Morocco
timeline.description: Adopted the title of King of Morocco.
